title: Fontlab question-what makes the red guides appear in the metrics window?
content:
When I’m setting up metrics in Fontlab sometimes a collection of red guidelines appears over the letters and I have to stop to delete them. I cannot figure out what I am doing that makes these things appear. What am I doing to cause this, and how do I make the guides go away with dragging them away one by one?

 [‹ Fontlab opentype features](http://web.archive.org/web/20080708211942/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45037 "Go to previous forum topic") [Clever way to make a font with only uppercase letters? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080708211942/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44964 "Go to next forum topic")
author: James Puckett

comments.content:
Hi James,  
this happens when you click the bar right above your glyph in the metrics window. When your mouse is over it it will change to a double vertical arrow allowing you to drag down a global (red) guide. If you just accidently click this bar it will still place a guide. A quick way to remove all guides is to move to the guides layer in a glyphs window and right click a ruler bar and choose remove guides.  
hope this helps,  
Josh
